preparing for an initial public offering in the second half of this year. The timing will depend on market conditions, Chrysler's financial results and its ability to refinance the government loans, Sergio Marchionne said. Because of these changed market conditions as well as the improvements in our performance and outlook, made possible through the support of the U.S. and Canadian governments, Chrysler intends to repay these loans in full at the earliest opportunity, Sergio Marchionne said in today's statement. The closely held automaker based in Auburn Hills, Michigan, earlier this week posted a$ 652 million loss for 2010. Fiat boosted its ownership in Chrysler
